attribs.name: repeating_npctrait_-LxB0jgenFwRD0nCAvyZ_desc
attribs.current: The drow's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 11). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:  At will: dancing lights 1/day each: darkness, faerie fire

attribs.name: repeating_npctrait_-LxB0jgenFwRD0nCAvya_desc
attribs.current: While in sunlight, the drow rogue has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-cantrip_-LxB0juBMtK2GT-QSJlD_spelldescription
attribs.current: You create up to four torch-sized lights within range, making them appear as torches, lanterns, or glowing orbs that hover in the air for the duration. You can also combine the four lights into one glowing vaguely humanoid form of Medium size. Whichever form you choose, each light sheds dim light in a 10-foot radius. As a bonus action on your turn, you can move the lights up to 60 feet to a new spot within range. A light must be within 20 feet of another light created by this spell, and a light winks out if it exceeds the spell’s range.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-cantrip_-LxB0juBMtK2GT-QSJlD_spellcomp_materials
attribs.current: A bit of phosphorus or wychwood, or a glowworm

attribs.name: repeating_spell-2_-LxB0juCczgoeZsMmE2z_spelldescription
attribs.current: Magical darkness spreads from a point you choose within range to fill a 15-foot-radius sphere for the duration. The darkness spreads around corners. A creature with darkvision can’t see through this darkness, and nonmagical light can’t illuminate it. If the point you choose is on an object you are holding or one that isn’t being worn or carried, the darkness emanates from the object and moves with it. Completely covering the source of the darkness with an opaque object, such as a bowl or a helm, blocks the darkness. If any of this spell’s area overlaps with an area of light created by a spell of 2nd level or lower, the spell that created the light is dispelled.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-2_-LxB0juCczgoeZsMmE2z_spellcomp_materials
attribs.current: Bat fur and a drop of pitch or piece of coal

attribs.name: repeating_spell-2_-LxB0juCczgoeZsMmE2z_spelltarget
attribs.current: A point you choose within range

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-LxB0juCczgoeZsMmE3-_spelldescription
attribs.current: Each object in a 20-foot cube within range is outlined in blue, green, or violet light (your choice). Any creature in the area when the spell is cast is also outlined in light if it fails a Dexterity saving throw. For the duration, objects and affected creatures shed dim light in a 10-foot radius. Any attack roll against an affected creature or object has advantage if the attacker can see it, and the affected creature or object can’t benefit from being invisible.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-LxB0juCczgoeZsMmE3-_spelltarget
attribs.current: Each object in a 20-foot cube within range

attribs.name: repeating_npcaction_-LxB2W61Yoojbr4ZOpfR_description
attribs.current: The drow makes two ranged or two mele attacks.

attribs.name: repeating_npcaction_-LxB2buhZyhOEtKtaTKW_description
attribs.current:
Description:
Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 hit, range 80/320 ft., one creature. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage, plus 7 (2d6) poison damage

Repeating crossbows function like their normal counterparts. However, they do not have the "loading," quality. Additionally, after 5 shots, the creature wielding the crossbow must spend an action reloading up to 5 bolts before it can be fired again. Their market value is double that of the normal version of the crossbow.

attribs.name: repeating_npcaction_-LxB3NeUZC1NOPzGdne4_description
attribs.current:
Description:

Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one creature. Hit: 5 (ld4 + 3) piercing damage in melee, or 5 (ld4 +3) piercing damage at range, plus 7 (2d6) poison damage.

attribs.name: repeating_npcaction_-LxB3NeUZC1NOPzGdne5_description
attribs.current:
Description:

Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one creature. Hit: 5 (ld4 + 3) piercing damage in melee, or 5 (ld4 +3) piercing damage at range, plus 7 (2d6) poison damage.

attribs.name: repeating_npctrait_-LxB5LctA5ocG9ZIiHgO_desc
attribs.current: The drow rogue has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put the drow rogue to sleep.

attribs.name: repeating_npctrait_-LxB5Z5N37ozJqqq6vI3_desc
attribs.current: The drow rogue can take the Disengage or Hide action as a bonus action on each of its turns.

attribs.name: repeating_npctrait_-LxB5haMPfGva8VtjFw3_desc
attribs.current: The drow rogue deals an extra 7(2d6) damage when it hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of the drow rogue that isn't incapacitated and the drow rogue doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.
